reviewText: A little generic. Not much to it.

What a unique and unusual film. Wow! They filmed a Native American wandering around NYC before, during and after 9/11 but the cool angle of the director is he shot it with a silent film era camera. Your sense of time is blurred. Events of the recent past seem to be surreal and maybe they are. I noticed it won the Tribeca Film Festival best documentary award and it makes sense. In a nutshell, this film captures the festival's mission to rise from the ashes and become revitalized. I won't give away the ending only to say moving from black & white film to color is symbolic of moving from a dream state to reality. Who knew that these cameras took color film back in the 20s. It just wasn't invented yet!
Native American month...so may check out this little film due to the subject matter. giving 3 for now.
